body.p: Customers must make their own cut-outs for input cable and conduit. Pull input power conduit through cut-outs. Connect input phase and ground cables to the PDU input terminal block or, for Manual Dual PDUs, directly to main input circuit breaker lugs. Torque lugs to the circuit breaker manufacturer’s specification, which are typically given on the circuit breaker.
For top cable entry, input and output share the same plate, which for input may have solid plate and for output solid plate or panelboard knockouts (KOs).

body.p: The customer safety ground is typically connected to the Component Mounting Plate in the Main Cabinet with mechanical lugs. Busbar ground connections can be optionally specified.

For front-access transformers, the Component Mounting Plate is removed. A ground connection is typically provided in the input cable tray. Alternatively, ground connection can be made to the PDU Input Terminal Block ().
